page.content:
R.A.F STATION BIGGIN HILL
The Armed Forces are represented by the Royal Air Force Station where the are 247 employees wearing uniform and 80 civillian employees. They rate from airmen to officers, from clerks to cleaners and from cooks to accountants. R.A.F. Biggin Hill was opened in 1916 as a communications centre. In 1952 it was split into two sections - the R.A.F. side and the civillian side run by the Bromley Council. The station was taken over by the Bromley Council because the runway couldn't be extended for the new jet fighters. Now the main function of the station is as an Officers and Aircrew Selection Centre. At the R.A.F. station there are married quarters for 320 wives and children.
